result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus T Boone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault/Use of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with victim & her family.

Sex Offender Registry Required. Maintain a stable residence. Crt permits def to have contact with his own children. Release of PSI report for sex offender treatment purposes.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

Signed
Preliminary hearing on September 2, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with K.R.C.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
  - The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $10,000 per case. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.
  If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.  
Defendant did not waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge - Br 12

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Chelsea E Wetjen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 2, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
